timeline.message:
[0238]
- Implement changes according to the proposal

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss I would switch lines 62 and 63 so ENABLE comes before DISABLE.  In this way, throughout the code the ordering will be consistent (you have ENABLE, DISABLE, and then USER_CHOICE).
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss You can remove the unused import on line 3.
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss You can remove the unused import on line 5.
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss You can remove the unused imports on lines 7 and 8.
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss I would suggest deleting lines 134-137.  It is correct since it is generated by the code generator tool, but it is out of scope of the PR.
timeline.author: santhanamk
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -101,18 +102,53 @@ * Array = true maxlength = 1000 minsize = 0 maxsize = 100 * Allows an app to prepopulate the text field with a list of suggested or completed entry as the user types. Set to an empty array to remove the auto-complete list from the screen * + * + * maskInputCharacters + * KeyboardInputMask + * Allows an app to mask entered characters on HMI + * N + * + * + * @since SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + * + * + * + * customizeKeys + * List + * Array of special characters to show in customizable Keys.If omitted, keyboard will showdefault special characters + * N + * {"array_min_size": 1, "array_max_size": 10, "string_min_length": 1, "string_max_length": 1} + * + * @since SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + * + * * * - * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0 + * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0 */ public class KeyboardProperties extends RPCStruct { public static final String KEY_KEYPRESS_MODE = "keypressMode"; public static final String KEY_KEYBOARD_LAYOUT = "keyboardLayout"; public static final String KEY_LIMITED_CHARACTER_LIST = "limitedCharacterList"; + /** + * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss I would suggest deleting lines140-142.  It is correct since it is generated by the code generator tool, but it is out of scope of the PR.
timeline.author: santhanamk
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -101,18 +102,53 @@ * Array = true maxlength = 1000 minsize = 0 maxsize = 100 * Allows an app to prepopulate the text field with a list of suggested or completed entry as the user types. Set to an empty array to remove the auto-complete list from the screen * + * + * maskInputCharacters + * KeyboardInputMask + * Allows an app to mask entered characters on HMI + * N + * + * + * @since SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + * + * + * + * customizeKeys + * List + * Array of special characters to show in customizable Keys.If omitted, keyboard will showdefault special characters + * N + * {"array_min_size": 1, "array_max_size": 10, "string_min_length": 1, "string_max_length": 1} + * + * @since SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 + * + * * * - * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0 + * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0 */ public class KeyboardProperties extends RPCStruct { public static final String KEY_KEYPRESS_MODE = "keypressMode"; public static final String KEY_KEYBOARD_LAYOUT = "keyboardLayout"; public static final String KEY_LIMITED_CHARACTER_LIST = "limitedCharacterList"; + /** + * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0 + * @deprecated in SmartDeviceLink 6.0.0 + */ @Deprecated public static final String KEY_AUTO_COMPLETE_TEXT = "autoCompleteText"; + /**

timeline.bodyText:
@kostyaBoss Lines 312-359 are good.  I would suggest removing anything unrelated to this that you have added.
(For example lines 303-306, 290-293, etc.).
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss On line 471 I would rename this to GENERAL_KEYBOARD_INPUT_MASK
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText:
@kostyaBoss On line 102 in the if statement you need to add: || key.equals(KeyboardProperties.KEY_CUSTOMIZE_KEYS) as a clause in the conditional.
So the if would look like: if (key.equals(KeyboardProperties.KEY_LIMITED_CHARACTER_LIST) || key.equals(KeyboardProperties.KEY_AUTO_COMPLETE_LIST) || key.equals(KeyboardProperties.KEY_CUSTOMIZE_KEYS))
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss Lines 61-68 are good.  You can revert the other formatting changes in this file, since they don't relate to the PR.
timeline.author: santhanamk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,35 +30,42 @@
  * POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE.
  */
 package com.smartdevicelink.proxy.rpc.enums;
-
 /**
  * Enumeration listing possible keyboard events.
+ * @since SmartDeviceLink 3.0.0
  */
 public enum KeyboardEvent {
-    /**
-     * The use has pressed the keyboard key (applies to both SINGLE_KEYPRESS and RESEND_CURRENT_ENTRY modes).
-     */
+	/** The use has pressed the keyboard key (applies to both SINGLE_KEYPRESS and RESEND_CURRENT_ENTRY modes).
+	 *
+	 */
 
     KEYPRESS,
-    /**
-     * The User has finished entering text from the keyboard and submitted the entry.
+    /** The User has finished entering text from the keyboard and submitted the entry.
+     *
      */
 
     ENTRY_SUBMITTED,
-    /**
-     * The User has pressed the HMI-defined "Cancel" button.
+    /** The User has pressed the HMI-defined "Cancel" button.
+     *
      */
 
     ENTRY_CANCELLED,
-    /**
-     * The User has not finished entering text and the keyboard is aborted with the event of higher priority.
+    /** The User has not finished entering text and the keyboard is aborted with the event of higher priority.
+     *
      */
     ENTRY_ABORTED,
     /**
      * @since SmartDeviceLink 4.0
      */
     ENTRY_VOICE,
-    ;
+    /**

timeline.author: santhanamk

replies.bodyText: @santanamk, This file is new and introduced in the XML related. Do we still need to rollback (these changes are from the generator)
replies.author: kboskin

replies.bodyText: @kostyaBoss So I went through the KeyboardCapabilities.java file and the only differences I see is (when comparing my generated file with yours) is in a few places you have added the @ s i n c e SmartDeviceLink 7.1.0 where the generator didn't generate it.  I think this is okay.  You don't need to change anything.
replies.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss I would remove lines 87-89 since it is not part of the proposal's XML.

timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss I would rename the function on line 3944 to validateKeyboardCapabilities.

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss On line 88 I would rename this to onKeyboardInputMaskHasChanged().
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss Since these enums were most recently added I would move the else if block on lines 341-342 below the last else if (around lines 362-363).
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss Do the unit tests in PresentChoiceSetOperationTests.java need to be updated?
timeline.author: santhanamk

replies.bodyText: @santanamk there were no tests covering the mask previously so I didn't add some new ones. To my mind, the PresentChoiceSetOperationTests are more about thread-safe testing, but we are not introducing some major changes at this point, so I don't think we should push the changes. Please, let me know if you still think we need to update them
replies.author: kboskin

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss Since these enums were most recently added I would move the else if block on lines 287-288 below the last else if (around line 310).
timeline.author: santhanamk

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss Do the unit tests in PresentKeyboardOperationTests.java need to be updated?
timeline.author: santhanamk

replies.bodyText: @santhanamk there were no tests covering the mask previously so I didn't add some new ones. To my mind, the PresentChoiceSetOperationTests are more about thread-safe testing, but we are not introducing some major changes at this point, so I don't think we should push the changes. Please, let me know if you still think we need to update them
replies.author: kboskin

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss On line 551 you are checking if getMaskInputCharactersSupported () != null .  However, that method returns a Boolean.  Do you need to change this logic?
timeline.author: santhanamk

replies.bodyText: I don't think so, because according to the proposal this is not a mandatory field, as far as I can remember, this means that calling getMaskInputCharactersSupported may produce NPE. That was the reason for this additional check
replies.author: kboskin

timeline.bodyText: @kostyaBoss Do you need to update the unit tests?
timeline.author: santhanamk

replies.bodyText: I don't think the ChoiceSetManagerTests is testing what's going on it it's DisplayCapabilityListener at least I didn't find it in the current tests and it seems to be never testing before. If we still need to add those tests - let me know
replies.author: kboskin

timeline.bodyText: You shouldn't rewrite the whole class. Please revert the changes and  only modify the lines that are affected by the proposal

bilal-alsharifi

timeline.bodyText: Can we rename this to onKeyboardDidUpdateInputMask to align with iOS?
timeline.author: bilal-alsharifi
bilal-alsharifi

timeline.bodyText:
After checking the proposal, I think that this is missing Android and iOS changes # 4. Here's how I think that would work:

The manager needs to handle what happens if the keyboard properties that the developer is trying to use are not supported.
If the KeyboardProperties that the developer is attempting to use an unsupported KeyboardLayout, the operation will need to fail with an error log.
If the KeyboardProperties that the developer is attempting to use uses too many customKeys for the current layout, we will shorten the amount they send to be the maximum amount and print a warning log.
If the KeyboardProperties that the developer is attempting to use uses a customKeys array that is empty, we will remove the array to nil.
If the KeyboardProperties that the developer is attempting to use uses maskInputCharacters when that is not supported on the current layout, we will remove the property to nil.
If the KeyboardCapabilities are not available, use the existing behavior of sending whatever the developer set.
Note that KeyboardProperties can be passed by developer in both setKeyboardConfiguration() && presentKeyboard() so we need to make sure that the properties are handled properly in both places.
timeline.author: bilal-alsharifi
